2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2019-01-20.headline_main: Older Women, Finding Contentment

2019-01-20.abstract: The “Extended Life” program has been expanded thanks to a large grant from the Mellon Foundation.
2019-01-20.snippet: The “Extended Life” program has been expanded thanks to a large grant from the Mellon Foundation.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: The Lower Manhattan Cultural Council’s “Extended Life” residencies are getting an extension.
2019-01-20.headline_main: Lower Manhattan Cultural Council Expands Residencies and Announces Recipients

2019-01-20.abstract: People who felt abandoned found an unlikely sense of community at the traffic circles. Without such a central gathering place, will the movement dissipate or get swept up in extremist politics?
2019-01-20.snippet: People who felt abandoned found an unlikely sense of community at the traffic circles. Without such a central gathering place, will the movement dissipate or get swept up in extremist politics?
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: LES ANDELYS, France — Before the local gendarmes shooed them away, the Yellow Vests found an unlikely sense of community on the traffic circles where they had gathered to demonstrate. There, people who before had felt alone, looked down upon and abandoned came together.
2019-01-20.headline_main: Denied Use of Roundabouts, Can Yellow Vests Stay United, Visible and Viable?

2019-01-20.abstract: Saturday was the last day for the restaurant, which opened days before sexual-harassment allegations surfaced against her partner, Ken Friedman.
2019-01-20.snippet: Saturday was the last day for the restaurant, which opened days before sexual-harassment allegations surfaced against her partner, Ken Friedman.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: The Hearth & Hound, the Hollywood restaurant opened by the chef April Bloomfield and the restaurateur Ken Friedman in 2017, closed after dinner service on Saturday night. Ms. Bloomfield, who made the announcement on the restaurant’s Instagram account, had acquired Mr. Friedman’s share of the Hearth & Hound last June, when their decade-long partnership was dissolved in the wake of the sexual harassment scandal that engulfed the business.
2019-01-20.headline_main: April Bloomfield Closes Her Los Angeles Restaurant Hearth & Hound

2019-01-20.abstract: Judges who preside over war-crimes trials and disputes between nations are entangled in awkward questions over how much money they should make.
2019-01-20.snippet: Judges who preside over war-crimes trials and disputes between nations are entangled in awkward questions over how much money they should make.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: THE HAGUE — They enjoy diplomatic perks, earn six-figure salaries and pay no taxes. As they enter and exit the courtrooms of The Hague in their adorned judicial robes, all rise in a required gesture of respect.
2019-01-20.headline_main: In The Hague’s Lofty Judicial Halls, Judges Wrangle Over Pay

2019-01-20.abstract: Majd Kamalmaz went missing after being stopped at a government checkpoint in Damascus. His family is now speaking out, hoping President Trump will prioritize his case.
2019-01-20.snippet: Majd Kamalmaz went missing after being stopped at a government checkpoint in Damascus. His family is now speaking out, hoping President Trump will prioritize his case.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT — Since disappearing in Syria nearly two years ago, an American therapist has missed the birth of one grandchild, then another.
2019-01-20.headline_main: An American Disappeared in Syria 2 Years Ago. His Family Wants Trump to Help.

2019-01-20.abstract: Mr. Ghosn is offering to personally pay for an apartment along with private security guards as he fights Japanese charges of financial misconduct.
2019-01-20.snippet: Mr. Ghosn is offering to personally pay for an apartment along with private security guards as he fights Japanese charges of financial misconduct.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Carlos Ghosn, the embattled global auto executive who has spent the last two months jailed in Japan, is offering to post a higher bail amount and personally pay for an apartment in Tokyo along with private security guards as he prepares a case seeking his release before trial.
2019-01-20.headline_main: Carlos Ghosn Offers Higher Bail and Security Guards in Bid to Be Freed From Jail

2019-01-20.abstract: The film sold about $40.6 million in tickets domestically during its opening weekend, on par with the performance of its 2017 predecessor, “Split.”
2019-01-20.snippet: The film sold about $40.6 million in tickets domestically during its opening weekend, on par with the performance of its 2017 predecessor, “Split.”
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: For a weekend dominated by M. Night Shyamalan, there weren’t many twists at the box office.
2019-01-20.headline_main: M. Night Shyamalan’s ‘Glass’ Tops the Box Office

2019-01-20.abstract: A blown call and a game-ending 57-yard field goal lifted Los Angeles past New Orleans and into the Super Bowl.
2019-01-20.snippet: A blown call and a game-ending 57-yard field goal lifted Los Angeles past New Orleans and into the Super Bowl.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: The triumphant locker room at the Super Dome started out so crowded Sunday night that personal space seemed like an extravagance. But as the room emptied, and the jubilant Los Angeles Rams continued a celebration that would rival any bacchanalia in this city’s French Quarter, the player who helped preserve their season by blatantly breaking the rules stood in the middle of it all, still in full uniform, delighted to answer question after question about his fateful, and fortunate, moment.
2019-01-20.headline_main: In the Din of the Dome, the Rams Beat the Saints in Overtime

2019-01-20.abstract: At first, the authorities claimed a family had been shot in a counterterrorism operation. Now, more than a dozen officers have been arrested.
2019-01-20.snippet: At first, the authorities claimed a family had been shot in a counterterrorism operation. Now, more than a dozen officers have been arrested.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan — At first, the police described a weekend shooting in central Pakistan as a successful operation against a group of terrorists: four dead, including a middle-aged couple, their daughter and another man.
2019-01-20.headline_main: Pakistan Arrests Officers After Children Who Survived Shooting Contradict Police

2019-01-20.abstract: Chirlane McCray sets a populist tone with an exhibition of female artists, long underrepresented at Gracie Mansion.
2019-01-20.snippet: Chirlane McCray sets a populist tone with an exhibition of female artists, long underrepresented at Gracie Mansion.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: Beginning on Jan. 22, visitors to Gracie Mansion will encounter a disconsolate sight as they approach the residence of the mayor of New York City and his family: a cloaked, faceless figure sitting on the ground behind its own severed feet, a signal that an unusual set of guests has arrived.
2019-01-20.headline_main: On Display at the People’s House: A Century of Persistence

2019-01-20.abstract: The men’s show season winds down with Thom Browne, deconstructed; Dior Men on a moving walkway; and Comme des Garçons finding beauty in the dark.
2019-01-20.snippet: The men’s show season winds down with Thom Browne, deconstructed; Dior Men on a moving walkway; and Comme des Garçons finding beauty in the dark.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: PARIS — When, at 12, Grayson Perry began covertly dressing in women’s clothes, he assumed in his innocence that the impulse must have something to do with wanting to be a member of the opposite sex. For decades he pursued his cross-dressing adventures, first in private and then very publicly as a Turner Prize-winning artist whose performances increasingly incorporated his feminine alter ego, Claire.
2019-01-20.headline_main: In Paris, the Hunt for Real Emotion

2019-01-20.abstract: A cultural reckoning remains distant as both sides quarrel in courts, college campuses and town squares over Confederate symbols in public spaces.
2019-01-20.snippet: A cultural reckoning remains distant as both sides quarrel in courts, college campuses and town squares over Confederate symbols in public spaces.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. — Randall L. Woodfin, the 37-year-old mayor of Birmingham, Ala., made an unlikely sales pitch the other day after glancing toward some black-and-white photos of his city’s segregated past.
2019-01-20.headline_main: Fate of Confederate Monuments Is Stalled by Competing Legal Battles

2019-01-20.abstract: Hurricane Maria led to a host of new plans to fix island barrios plagued by chronic flooding. A look at the Vietnam neighborhood shows why they may never be achieved.
2019-01-20.snippet: Hurricane Maria led to a host of new plans to fix island barrios plagued by chronic flooding. A look at the Vietnam neighborhood shows why they may never be achieved.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: GUAYNABO, P.R. — Victor Manuel Torres raised one hand, about waist level, indicating how high the sea rose in his house during Hurricane Maria last year.
2019-01-20.headline_main: Rebuilding a Puerto Rico Barrio: ‘Dead Is the Only Way They’ll Ever Get Me to Leave’

2019-01-20.abstract: The United Nations said the peacekeepers were killed, and 25 others wounded, while repelling an attack.
2019-01-20.snippet: The United Nations said the peacekeepers were killed, and 25 others wounded, while repelling an attack.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: A branch of Al Qaeda in northwestern Africa claimed responsibility for an attack on a United Nations base in Mali that killed 10 Chadian peacekeepers on Sunday, saying it was in response to Chad’s resumption of diplomatic relations with Israel.
2019-01-20.headline_main: Al Qaeda Claims U.N. Peacekeeper Attack That Killed 10 in Mali

2019-01-20.abstract: From the posting of the dossier to the publication of a story now in dispute, BuzzFeed News is learning about the perils of the chase.
2019-01-20.snippet: From the posting of the dossier to the publication of a story now in dispute, BuzzFeed News is learning about the perils of the chase.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: This is, in many respects, a golden age for journalism.
2019-01-20.headline_main: BuzzFeed News in Limbo Land

2019-01-20.abstract: The shutdown has not only widened the divide between the Senate majority leader and the House speaker, but also imperiled prospects for passing major legislation when the impasse ends.
2019-01-20.snippet: The shutdown has not only widened the divide between the Senate majority leader and the House speaker, but also imperiled prospects for passing major legislation when the impasse ends.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As the reality of divided government sank in the day after the midterm elections, Senator Mitch McConnell, the Kentucky Republican who had just expanded his majority, held out hope that he and incoming Speaker Nancy Pelosi would find a way to get things done despite their deep differences.
2019-01-20.headline_main: McConnell and Pelosi Have a Fraught Relationship. The Shutdown Hasn’t Helped.

2019-01-20.abstract: Celine Fall Menswear Collection.
2019-01-20.snippet: Celine Fall Menswear Collection.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: Celine Fall Menswear Collection.
2019-01-20.headline_main: Celine: Fall 2019

2019-01-20.abstract: In a meditative program, Cantata Profana offers a quietly riveting performance of an eerie piece about the final chapter in the life of a nun and mystic.
2019-01-20.snippet: In a meditative program, Cantata Profana offers a quietly riveting performance of an eerie piece about the final chapter in the life of a nun and mystic.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: Imagine a Renaissance-era nun, a mystic in the throes of dying, uttering her visions and predictions in sporadic, rapid-fire bursts while novices stand guard trying to understand and write down her words.
2019-01-20.headline_main: Review: Cantata Profana Captures the Death of a Saint

2019-01-20.abstract: Mr. Sy, who started out selling surplus boots in Manila after World War II, has been called the “father of modern Philippine retail.”
2019-01-20.snippet: Mr. Sy, who started out selling surplus boots in Manila after World War II, has been called the “father of modern Philippine retail.”
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: MANILA — Henry Sy, a tycoon known as the “father of modern Philippine retail,” whose chain of super malls changed the country’s retail landscape, died on Saturday in Manila. He was 94.
2019-01-20.headline_main: Henry Sy, 94, Dies; Philippines’ Richest Man and a Shopping Mall Tycoon

2019-01-20.abstract: If Joaquín Guzmán Loera, the drug kingpin known as El Chapo, testifies, it would a remarkable moment in a trial already filled with stunning developments.
2019-01-20.snippet: If Joaquín Guzmán Loera, the drug kingpin known as El Chapo, testifies, it would a remarkable moment in a trial already filled with stunning developments.

2019-01-20.headline_main: At El Chapo Trial, a Potential Star Witness: El Chapo

2019-01-20.snippet: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, January 21, 2019.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, January 21, 2019.
2019-01-20.headline_main: No Corrections: January 21, 2019

2019-01-20.abstract: Sean Biggins makes his New York Times Crossword debut by marking a special occasion.
2019-01-20.snippet: Sean Biggins makes his New York Times Crossword debut by marking a special occasion.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: MONDAY PUZZLE — We welcome Sean Biggins to the New York Times Crossword roster, and he offers us a contemplative puzzle, fitting for this day of observance.
2019-01-20.headline_main: For the Cause

2019-01-20.abstract: Australia has not produced a male Grand Slam singles champion or a top-10 men’s player in more than 10 years. Instead, men’s tennis in Australia is now a soap opera.
2019-01-20.snippet: Australia has not produced a male Grand Slam singles champion or a top-10 men’s player in more than 10 years. Instead, men’s tennis in Australia is now a soap opera.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: MELBOURNE, Australia — As the tennis world was transfixed on Andy Murray  as he played what may have been the final match of his career last Monday night, another drama was beginning in Interview Room 2 at the Australian Open.
2019-01-20.headline_main: For Australian Men, Off-Court Drama Overshadows the Tennis

2019-01-20.abstract: The red carpet was there as the Arab League held its fourth economic and social summit. But it was trod upon by only the smallest of feet.
2019-01-20.snippet: The red carpet was there as the Arab League held its fourth economic and social summit. But it was trod upon by only the smallest of feet.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT — The eyes of the world were nowhere near Beirut, where the kings and presidents of the Arab world had been ceremoniously summoned to a summit of the Arab League over the weekend and had, in all but two cases, ceremoniously declined.
2019-01-20.headline_main: A League of Their Own, as Few Arab Leaders Attend Summit

2019-01-20.abstract: As the U.S.-China trade war escalates, Canada is a beaver between bulls.
2019-01-20.snippet: As the U.S.-China trade war escalates, Canada is a beaver between bulls.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: Two Canadians seized by authorities in China remain detained in an apparent tit-for-tat brawl stemming from the arrest of a top Chinese technology executive in Vancouver, Canada. The case involving Meng Wanzhou, chief financial officer of Huawei, is seen as an escalation of the trade war between the United States and China.
2019-01-20.headline_main: The Hazards of Being Canadian

2019-01-20.abstract: Students and parents are angered at administrators at Poly Prep Country Day School for the school’s reaction to a video of two students in blackface making racist gestures.
2019-01-20.snippet: Students and parents are angered at administrators at Poly Prep Country Day School for the school’s reaction to a video of two students in blackface making racist gestures.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: [What you need to know to start the day: Get New York Today in your inbox.]
2019-01-20.headline_main: Blackface Video Has Elite New York Private School in an Uproar

2019-01-20.abstract: For people who have done business with the president, the protracted fight over the government shutdown reflects a time-tested playbook.
2019-01-20.snippet: For people who have done business with the president, the protracted fight over the government shutdown reflects a time-tested playbook.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: Three decades ago, Donald J. Trump waged a public battle with the talk show host Merv Griffin to take control of what would become Mr. Trump’s third Atlantic City casino. Executives at Mr. Trump’s company warned that the casino would siphon revenue from the others. Analysts predicted the associated debt would crush him.
2019-01-20.headline_main: In Business and Governing, Trump Seeks Victory in Chaos

2019-01-20.abstract: A convergence of racial and religious groups set the stage for the viral moment. “I stepped in between to pray,” Nathan Phillips said on Sunday.
2019-01-20.snippet: A convergence of racial and religious groups set the stage for the viral moment. “I stepped in between to pray,” Nathan Phillips said on Sunday.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: A fuller and more complicated picture emerged on Sunday of the videotaped encounter between a Native American man and a throng of high school boys wearing “Make America Great Again” gear outside the Lincoln Memorial in Washington.
2019-01-20.headline_main: Fuller Picture Emerges of Viral Video of Native American Man and Catholic Students

2019-01-20.abstract: The victory over the Chiefs means Tom Brady and Co. will be playing for the title for the ninth time in the last two decades.
2019-01-20.snippet: The victory over the Chiefs means Tom Brady and Co. will be playing for the title for the ninth time in the last two decades.
2019-01-20.lead_paragraph: As Tom Brady led the New England Patriots down the field in the crucible of overtime, there was a familiar sense of inevitability, an atmosphere that was both tense and predictable. These were only the latest minutes in a cavalcade of triumphant overtime postseason Patriots moments that stretch from a snowy game in 2002 to the one played in frigid conditions here Sunday night.
2019-01-20.headline_main: This Time It Took Overtime but the Patriots Are Back in the Super Bowl Yet Again

2019-01-21.abstract: “The white moderate” was more of an obstacle than “the Ku Klux Klanner.”
2019-01-21.snippet: “The white moderate” was more of an obstacle than “the Ku Klux Klanner.”
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: “There is a pressing need for a liberalism in the North which is truly liberal,” the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. told an interracial audience in New York City in 1960. He called for a liberalism that “rises up with righteous indignation when a Negro is lynched in Mississippi, but will be equally incensed when a Negro is denied the right to live in his neighborhood.”
2019-01-21.headline_main: What King Said About Northern Liberalism

2019-01-21.abstract: Baseball’s Hall of Fame shouldn’t continue to overlook someone whose influence on the game has been profound.
2019-01-21.snippet: Baseball’s Hall of Fame shouldn’t continue to overlook someone whose influence on the game has been profound.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: This week, the Baseball Hall of Fame will announce a new class of inductees, setting off rounds of celebrations — and debates. Fans will argue over whether Mariano Rivera deserves unanimous approval, or whether the use of performance-enhancing drugs should permanently block the enshrinement of Barry Bonds.
2019-01-21.headline_main: Bill James Has the Required Numbers

2019-01-21.abstract: President Trump and hard-line advisers want to isolate and undermine the government in Tehran. Engagement is a better option.
2019-01-21.snippet: President Trump and hard-line advisers want to isolate and undermine the government in Tehran. Engagement is a better option.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: John Limbert belongs to an exclusive club — the 52 American diplomats held hostage by Iran for 444 days during the 1979 Islamic Revolution. Since that crisis, which began 40 years ago next month, the two countries shared an enmity that has only grown worse under President Trump.
2019-01-21.headline_main: Iran and the United States: Doomed to Be Forever Enemies?

2019-01-21.abstract: The grass-roots progressive activism of the past two years has been inspiring. But it’s still a shadow of what the country needs.
2019-01-21.snippet: The grass-roots progressive activism of the past two years has been inspiring. But it’s still a shadow of what the country needs.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: The grass-roots progressive movement known as the resistance has had a very good two years. It beat back attempts to take health insurance away from millions of Americans, and it helped defeat a Republican House majority that was enabling President Trump. Neither of those outcomes looked likely when he took office.
2019-01-21.headline_main: The Shutdown Shows the Weakness of the Resistance

2019-01-21.abstract: Cliff Sims, a former communications staff member, portrays a West Wing full of back-stabbing and duplicity under President Trump in “Team of Vipers.”
2019-01-21.snippet: Cliff Sims, a former communications staff member, portrays a West Wing full of back-stabbing and duplicity under President Trump in “Team of Vipers.”
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: John F. Kelly, as White House chief of staff, presented himself as the man leading a charge of “country first, president second.” The attorney general suggested administering lie-detector tests to the small group of people with access to transcripts of the president’s calls with foreign leaders. And President Trump sought a list of “enemies” working in the White House communications shop.
2019-01-21.headline_main: Book by Former Staff Member Describes a White House ‘Out of Control’

2019-01-21.abstract: President Trump says that he has done more to counter Russian aggression than other recent presidents. But, officials say, Mr. Trump has gone along with such actions reluctantly or under pressure.
2019-01-21.snippet: President Trump says that he has done more to counter Russian aggression than other recent presidents. But, officials say, Mr. Trump has gone along with such actions reluctantly or under pressure.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After Russian forces seized three Ukrainian ships in November and threatened to turn the Sea of Azov into a Russian lake, Trump administration officials outlined possible responses like imposing additional sanctions, sending ships to make port calls or deploying monitors.
2019-01-21.headline_main: U.S. Policy on Russia? Trump and His Team Might Give Different Answers

2019-01-21.abstract: Quotation of the Day for Monday, January 21, 2019.
2019-01-21.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Monday, January 21, 2019.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: “I was really hoping to get snowed in and watch movies and gorge myself on junk food, but that didn’t happen, so here I am at work.”
2019-01-21.headline_main: Quotation of the Day: Winter’s One-Two Punch: Behind the Storm, a Dangerous Flash Freeze

2019-01-21.abstract: Brianna gets a chance to confront her demons. Is she sure that’s a good idea?
2019-01-21.snippet: Brianna gets a chance to confront her demons. Is she sure that’s a good idea?
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: This has been an uneven season. On top of the usual demands — two time periods, two countries, two major couples, a villain, an ever-expanding supporting cast — there were the racial issues of colonial America, Brianna’s rape, and the fracturing of the Frasers. No wonder this week’s episode struggled to weave things back together as we near the season finale.
2019-01-21.headline_main: ‘Outlander’ Season 4, Episode 12: The Last Word

2019-01-21.abstract: Calvin Trillin has turned his heartbroken memoir into a stage play that reincarnates his beloved wife and muse.
2019-01-21.snippet: Calvin Trillin has turned his heartbroken memoir into a stage play that reincarnates his beloved wife and muse.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: Wedded love, unless it is the kind masquerading as fury, is not very often — or very well — portrayed onstage. Where is the drama in the unimpeded marriage of true minds?
2019-01-21.headline_main: Review: ‘About Alice’ Brings a Husband’s Eulogy to Life

2019-01-21.abstract: It may not be the cure-all to inequity, but we need a starting point.
2019-01-21.snippet: It may not be the cure-all to inequity, but we need a starting point.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: Welcome to the Smarter Living newsletter! Every Monday, we email readers with tips and advice for living a better, more fulfilling life. Sign up here to get it in your inbox.
2019-01-21.headline_main: Want to Close the Pay Gap? Pay Transparency Will Help

2019-01-21.abstract: The mystery stays compelling, but it’s disappointing to see Hays slurping Jack Daniels and carping at his wife.
2019-01-21.snippet: The mystery stays compelling, but it’s disappointing to see Hays slurping Jack Daniels and carping at his wife.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: Because “True Detective” has no narrative continuity from season to season, it is united instead by a set of distinguishing elements — “auteur stamps” to put it kindly, “clichés” to put it less so.
2019-01-21.headline_main: ‘True Detective’ Season 3, Episode 3: Lighten Up, Dad

2019-01-21.abstract: New figures suggest the economic outlook may be improving but that growth has slowed more than the headline figure shows.
2019-01-21.snippet: New figures suggest the economic outlook may be improving but that growth has slowed more than the headline figure shows.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — China’s economy is slowing, and the slowdown is probably worse than Beijing says.
2019-01-21.headline_main: China’s Economy, by the Numbers, Is Worse Than It Looks

2019-01-21.abstract: A blown pass-interference call by the officials late in Los Angeles’s win over the Saints in the N.F.C. Championship left the Saints with a familiar sense of injustice.
2019-01-21.snippet: A blown pass-interference call by the officials late in Los Angeles’s win over the Saints in the N.F.C. Championship left the Saints with a familiar sense of injustice.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS — The Saints’ locker room at the Superdome was consumed by silence. Players dressed quickly before departing. A mountain of shoulder pads formed at the center of the room, next to a couple of yellow duffel bags labeled “PLAYOFFS.” Defensive tackle David Onyemata pulled on black jeans with designer rips that revealed skinned knees.
2019-01-21.headline_main: Missed Call Dooms Saints, Thrills Rams and Pains New Orleans

2019-01-21.abstract: After years of ambiguity, the Israel leadership has grown bolder about acknowledging strikes in Syria just after they occur, raising fears of prompting retaliation.
2019-01-21.snippet: After years of ambiguity, the Israel leadership has grown bolder about acknowledging strikes in Syria just after they occur, raising fears of prompting retaliation.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — The Israeli military said on Monday that it had attacked Iranian military targets in Syria, capping an exchange of blows in a rare, direct confrontation between the two antagonists that risks escalating the fight over Iran’s military entrenchment in Syria.
2019-01-21.headline_main: Israel Confirms Attacks on Iranian Targets in Syria

2019-01-21.abstract: A conspiracy theory with ancient roots and a bloody history.
2019-01-21.snippet: A conspiracy theory with ancient roots and a bloody history.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: In 2012, during one of Israel’s periodic wars with Hamas in Gaza, Ilhan Omar, at the time a 32-year-old nutrition coordinator with the Minnesota Department of Education, tweeted the following: “Israel has hypnotized the world, may Allah awaken the people and help them see the evil doings of Israel. #Gaza #Palestine #Israel”
2019-01-21.headline_main: Ilhan Omar and the Myth of Jewish Hypnosis

2019-01-21.abstract: Rock ’n’ roll gets a history lesson in “Rumble” on PBS, and “Justice” on Netflix is a law drama based in the United Arab Emirates.

2019-01-21.abstract: Democrats described the proposal, offering temporary protection for young undocumented immigrants in exchange for border wall funding, as a “hostage taking.”
2019-01-21.snippet: Democrats described the proposal, offering temporary protection for young undocumented immigrants in exchange for border wall funding, as a “hostage taking.”
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: Good Monday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.
2019-01-21.headline_main: On Politics: Democrats Reject Trump’s Deal on Dreamers

2019-01-21.abstract: Photographers captured scenes in the skies as the Earth’s shadow covered the moon.
2019-01-21.snippet: Photographers captured scenes in the skies as the Earth’s shadow covered the moon.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: There it was in the night sky as Sunday stretched into Monday: a total lunar eclipse. Where people had clear conditions and unobstructed views, the moon took on a coppery red color.
2019-01-21.headline_main: Lunar Eclipse and Supermoon: Photos From Around the World

2019-01-21.abstract: The Napoli owner Aurelio De Laurentiis is pressing for changes that would punish teams that he feels don’t take their responsibilities seriously.
2019-01-21.snippet: The Napoli owner Aurelio De Laurentiis is pressing for changes that would punish teams that he feels don’t take their responsibilities seriously.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: The trick, with Aurelio De Laurentiis, is to sit and to wait. He tends to take the scenic route through a conversation; his answers come wrapped in anecdotes and parables, laced with riddles and rhetorical questions.
2019-01-21.headline_main: Film in His Blood, a Soccer Revolution in His Plans

2019-01-21.abstract: With Rapid DNA machines, genetic fingerprinting could become as routine as the old-fashioned kind. But forensic experts see a potential for misuse.
2019-01-21.snippet: With Rapid DNA machines, genetic fingerprinting could become as routine as the old-fashioned kind. But forensic experts see a potential for misuse.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: BENSALEM, Pa. — They call it the “magic box.” Its trick is speedy, nearly automated processing of DNA.
2019-01-21.headline_main: Coming Soon to a Police Station Near You: The DNA ‘Magic Box’

2019-01-21.abstract: With its Baroque architecture and thriving textile scene, this former colonial capital is among Central America’s most beguiling destinations.
2019-01-21.snippet: With its Baroque architecture and thriving textile scene, this former colonial capital is among Central America’s most beguiling destinations.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: Nestled in the forested hills of southern Guatemala, the small city of Antigua was once the most prominent seat of Spanish colonial government between Mexico City and Lima, Peru. Founded in the early 16th century, it served as Guatemala’s capital for almost 300 years, until 1773, when it was abandoned by crown officials following a series of devastating volcanic eruptions, earthquakes and floods. In the mid-1800s, agriculturists took note of Antigua’s rich volcanic soils, and the city thrived once again, as a center of coffee and grain production. It was during this period that its canary-colored Santa Catalina Arch, built in 1694 as a walkway for nuns, received its domed clock tower, becoming Antigua’s most iconic monument. In 1979, Unesco designated Antigua a World Heritage Site, ensuring the protection of its architectural and cultural legacy.
2019-01-21.headline_main: A Guide to Antigua, Guatemala: A Candy-Colored City Framed by Volcanoes

2019-01-21.abstract: Rustic shelters called bothies — more than 100 of which are scattered throughout England, Wales and Scotland — are an indispensable, if little-known, element of British hill culture.
2019-01-21.snippet: Rustic shelters called bothies — more than 100 of which are scattered throughout England, Wales and Scotland — are an indispensable, if little-known, element of British hill culture.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: By the time the tiny hut came into view, nestled high in a corrie in Scotland’s 1,748-square-mile Cairngorms National Park, I’d trekked for nearly nine miles, three of which, regrettably, I’d had to navigate after nightfall. The hike, through a broad valley in the Eastern Highlands called Glen Derry, carried me past groves of Scots pines and over a series of streams, some of which, lined with slick steppingstones, made for precarious crossings. All the while, two rows of smooth, eroded mountain peaks enclosed me in an amphitheater of muted colors: hazel-hued heather, golden grasses. Though much of my walk was solitary, the flickering glow in the hut’s main window, I knew, meant I’d have some company for the night and the warmth of a fire to greet me.
2019-01-21.headline_main: In Britain, Enraptured by the Wild, Lonely and Remote

2019-01-21.abstract: A century ago, Irish nationalists broke from Britain — and set the mold for decades of independence movements.
2019-01-21.snippet: A century ago, Irish nationalists broke from Britain — and set the mold for decades of independence movements.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: In 1916, Irish nationalists sparked the Easter Rising, a bloody revolt against the British, who had controlled Ireland for some 700 years. They failed in their immediate goal — and many of them were executed or jailed in retribution — but the violence left behind a wave of separatist sentiment across the island. Three years later, with the ink from the armistice ending World War I still drying and President Woodrow Wilson calling for “political independence and territorial integrity to great and small states alike,” the surviving nationalists realized they had a second chance. On Jan. 21, 1919, they declared independence.
2019-01-21.headline_main: How the Irish Won Their Freedom

2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The commemoration of Martin Luther King’s Birthday on Monday became a day of confession, invective and promise for prominent Democrats, who used events across the country honoring the slain civil rights leader to try to inoculate themselves from criticism, lash out at President Trump as a racist and, in one case, begin a history-making run for the White House.
2019-01-21.headline_main: On King Holiday, Democrats Convey Hope, Remorse and Invective Against Trump

2019-01-21.abstract: A program at Film Forum showcases her brilliance as a director in movies like “A New Leaf” and, yes, “Ishtar.”
2019-01-21.snippet: A program at Film Forum showcases her brilliance as a director in movies like “A New Leaf” and, yes, “Ishtar.”
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: The troubles on “A New Leaf” (1971), Elaine May’s directorial debut, were worrisome before they were legion. She had never directed a movie and had to learn as she went along. The head of the studio changed while she was making it (the new boss wasn’t keen). And then there was her peerless star, Walter Matthau, whom she grew to love but who called her Mrs. Hitler. Years later, she suggested what the real problem was. People thought that May, a slight, beautiful woman, was “a nice girl, and the thing is, of course, I wasn’t a nice girl.” She added, “And when they found this out, they hated me all the more.”
2019-01-21.headline_main: The Marvelous Ms. Elaine May

2019-01-21.abstract: Two tankers performing a fuel transfer near the contested Kerch Strait caught fire, leading to the deaths. The strait is a sticking point in relations between Russia and Ukraine.
2019-01-21.snippet: Two tankers performing a fuel transfer near the contested Kerch Strait caught fire, leading to the deaths. The strait is a sticking point in relations between Russia and Ukraine.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — An explosion and a fire involving two tanker ships near the contested Kerch Strait, the waterway separating Crimea from mainland Russia, left at least 11 sailors dead on Monday and several missing, according to Russian news reports.
2019-01-21.headline_main: Explosion and Fire Off Crimea Kill 11 Sailors

2019-01-21.abstract: The Iowa congressman has been saying offensive things for years but many of his supporters don’t seem concerned.
2019-01-21.snippet: The Iowa congressman has been saying offensive things for years but many of his supporters don’t seem concerned.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: STORM LAKE, Iowa  — The Republicans in Des Moines and Washington are doing what they can to run away from and run off Representative Steve King, the Republican from my district, for yet more of his outlandish remarks over white supremacy, nationalism and western civilization — remarks that simply echo things he has said many times over the past two decades in my paper, The Storm Lake Times.
2019-01-21.headline_main: They Still Like Steve King Here

2019-01-21.abstract: With the Arctic warming rapidly, ice loss in Greenland is accelerating and may soon be a major factor in rising sea levels, according to a new study.
2019-01-21.snippet: With the Arctic warming rapidly, ice loss in Greenland is accelerating and may soon be a major factor in rising sea levels, according to a new study.
2019-01-21.lead_paragraph: Greenland’s enormous ice sheet is melting at such an accelerated rate that it may have reached a “tipping point” and could become a major factor in sea-level rise around the world within two decades, scientists said in a study published on Monday.
2019-01-21.headline_main: Greenland’s Melting Ice Nears a ‘Tipping Point,’ Scientists Say

2019-01-21.abstract: Cuadrilla Resources has stopped its hydraulic fracturing in Lancashire and pulled equipment off the site. The future of fracking in Britain remains uncertain.

2019-01-21.headline_main: Fracking Wasn’t Supposed to Cause Quakes in U.K. But Then the Ground Shook.

He was 82.

2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: Racism, homophobia, sexism, police violence, immigration: All of these issues come up in “Awake.” It would be a lot for any one play — but “Awake” has nine of them, each clocking in at around 10 or 15 minutes. To its credit, the show, written and directed by K. Lorrel Manning at the Barrow Group, moves at a steady clip. After all, the best thing about an anthology is that if an individual play isn’t very good, it also won’t be very long.

After enthusiastically greeting and hugging several of the workers, Topf, 62, came to a sweltering room filled with humming washing machines and dryers. “This is my life,” he said. “The artists live their life, and I live my laundry life.”

2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: At sunrise, there it was: a red-tailed hawk, its gyre widening over the United States Capitol building in the Creamsicle-colored light, like the world’s least subtle literary reference. It was still there by midafternoon, drifting on the thermals over the mostly depopulated National Mall, wheeling occasionally past the window in the hallway outside the office where the Senate majority leader, Mitch McConnell, sat on the 20th day of what would soon become the longest government shutdown in American history.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Mitch McConnell Got Everything He Wanted. But at What Cost?

2019-01-22.abstract: A chance to encounter the sublime — without having to leave your backyard.
2019-01-22.snippet: A chance to encounter the sublime — without having to leave your backyard.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: I can still vividly recall the first spider web I watched being spun in earnest, in the unlikely setting of an industrial estate in Central London. While taking a break from a tedious data-entry job, I stepped outside onto a fire escape to find a dun-brown spider dangling at eye level from the wrought iron. Ordinarily I would have swatted it away with a wave of the arm. But something about this creature persuaded me to stop and observe as she traversed back and forth between stair and balustrade, constructing an elaborate death trap. From frame to completion, the spider’s labor took about an hour, and I scrutinized the whole thing, entranced — which might help explain why I was sacked later that week.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Letter of Recommendation: Spider Webs

2019-01-22.snippet: Paul N. Whelan, a former United States Marine, was arrested after being given a thumb drive of state secrets, believing it to contain vacation pictures, his lawyer says.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — A former United States Marine who was arrested in Moscow on spying charges had been handed a flash drive that he thought contained pictures of churches but was instead loaded with classified information, his lawyer said on Tuesday.

2019-01-22.abstract: A new documentary tells the painful but ultimately hopeful story of a classical music quintet of siblings, three of whom were molested by their father.
2019-01-22.snippet: A new documentary tells the painful but ultimately hopeful story of a classical music quintet of siblings, three of whom were molested by their father.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: In this documentary about siblings in a classical music ensemble, one of the girls, then in her early teens, describes herself as “optimistic and happy.” The all-Americanness of the three sisters and two brothers who came to be known as the 5 Browns manifested itself in a variety of ways. Born in the late 1970s and early 1980s, and raised in Utah, they were avatars of well-scrubbed cheer and hard work. Home-schooled, each one practiced piano at all hours.
2019-01-22.headline_main: ‘The 5 Browns’ Review: United by Music and Scarred by Sexual Abuse

Kavanaugh in October.

Some of the biggest contenders are still in theaters, but many are already streaming. Here’s a rundown of where to find those nominees that are streaming in the biggest categories, with links to our original reviews.

2019-01-22.headline_main: Germany and France Renew Their Vows, but Challenges Abound

2019-01-22.abstract: A whole one. Yes, with the bones. Alison Roman talks you through it.

2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: There are certain recipes that are immediately appealing, beloved by most and attainable by all. They tend to be easy, comforting, delicious-looking no-brainers that don’t require much persuading for people to make them. Think giant bowls of gloriously cheesy pasta.
2019-01-22.headline_main: The Fish You Really Should Be Cooking

2019-01-22.abstract: For more and more people, learning about their genetic makeup is just the first step. The second is heading to the airport so they can explore their roots in person.

2019-01-22.abstract: The Oscar nominees for best picture have been announced. Here’s a rundown on the gossip, the politics and the critical response surrounding the eight contenders

But after a few solid months of nonstop chatter, even moviegoers who are all caught up on viewing may still want to catch up on what’s being said.

2019-01-22.abstract: In her solo in George Balanchine’s “Tschaikovsky Piano Concerto No. 2,” City Ballet’s Teresa Reichlen said, she shoos the other dancers aside “because it’s my turn to dance.”

Kennedy’s Peace Corps, Bill Clinton’s AmeriCorps and other service organizations and made him America’s volunteer in chief, died on Monday night in Washington. He was 92.

2019-01-22.abstract: Visiting chefs, a prototype automobile and a fashionable branding strategy converge at Intersect by Lexus.
2019-01-22.snippet: Visiting chefs, a prototype automobile and a fashionable branding strategy converge at Intersect by Lexus.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: The nice man who brought samples of the banoffee macaron to me and other customers one recent morning began, a few moments later, to gently buff the doors and windows of a new, rose-gold prototype car with a soft cloth. I could see this because the car and I were sharing a room on West 14th Street. The car was in the back and I was in the middle, sitting at one of the cafe tables near the stairs to the second floor, where there is a bar shaped like a wheel and a restaurant with a menu devised by Gregory Marchand, the chef of the Frenchie restaurants in Paris and London.
2019-01-22.headline_main: At Last, a Restaurant With That New-Car Smell

2019-01-22.abstract: The deal includes caps on class sizes and hiring full-time nurses for every school, as well as a 6 percent pay raise for teachers.
2019-01-22.snippet: The deal includes caps on class sizes and hiring full-time nurses for every school, as well as a 6 percent pay raise for teachers.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Los Angeles public school teachers reached a deal with officials on Tuesday to end a weeklong strike that had affected more than half a million students, winning an array of supplementary services after an era in education marked by attacks on traditional public schools and their teachers.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Los Angeles Teachers’ Strike to End as Deal Is Reached

2019-01-22.abstract: The Senate will take up President Trump’s offer to pair wall funding with some immigrant legal protections, but an added measure to restrict asylum claims has drawn protests.
2019-01-22.snippet: The Senate will take up President Trump’s offer to pair wall funding with some immigrant legal protections, but an added measure to restrict asylum claims has drawn protests.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Senate is poised as early as Tuesday to act on a Trump-backed measure to end the partial government shutdown, but a bill promoted as a compromise to pair the president’s wall with legal protections for some immigrants would also severely restrict migrants’ ability to claim asylum, drawing fierce opposition from immigrant rights groups.
2019-01-22.headline_main: G.O.P. Bill to End Shutdown Draws Protests Over Asylum Restrictions

2019-01-22.abstract: We redefined the term to include all the staple ingredients that make your cooking better and faster.
2019-01-22.snippet: We redefined the term to include all the staple ingredients that make your cooking better and faster.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: For many cooks, January brings new resolve to an eternal goal: having a well-stocked pantry. You may crave shelf systems and bulk ingredients, and sparkling new containers to keep them in. But look more closely at those catalogs and Instagram posts, and ask yourself: Will my spice jars ever truly match? Do I really need to store apples in a hanging basket? Often, the ideas are about decorating, not cooking.
2019-01-22.headline_main: A Modern Cook’s Pantry

2019-01-22.abstract: By 2017, mean wait time at V.A. hospitals had gone down 17.7 days, while rising to 29.8 for private practitioners.
2019-01-22.snippet: By 2017, mean wait time at V.A. hospitals had gone down 17.7 days, while rising to 29.8 for private practitioners.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: Wait times for an appointment at Veterans Affairs hospitals have decreased since 2014 and are now, on average, shorter than those in the private sector, a new study shows.
2019-01-22.headline_main: V.A. Wait Times Now Shorter Than for Private Doctors

2019-01-22.abstract: With his first Oscar nomination, for best actor, the star of the Freddie Mercury biopic looks back on a role he doesn’t want to leave behind.
2019-01-22.snippet: With his first Oscar nomination, for best actor, the star of the Freddie Mercury biopic looks back on a role he doesn’t want to leave behind.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: For Rami Malek, his first Oscar nomination — for his turn as Freddie Mercury in the Queen biopic “Bohemian Rhapsody” — means talking about teeth. He said that preproduction discussions about the singer’s pearly whites, including their size, their shape — were as important as the chompers themselves.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Rami Malek on ‘Bohemian Rhapsody,’ Queen and Bryan Singer

2019-01-22.abstract: Under pressure from nationalists, the Russian president backed off previous hints that he was ready to end a 73-year tussle over the Kurile Islands.
2019-01-22.snippet: Under pressure from nationalists, the Russian president backed off previous hints that he was ready to end a 73-year tussle over the Kurile Islands.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia on Tuesday dashed Japanese hopes of a settlement any time soon to a territorial dispute that has festered since 1945, declaring after a meeting with the visiting Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan that there was still much “painstaking work” ahead.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Putin Quashes Japanese Hopes of End to Island Dispute

2019-01-22.abstract: A study showed that when some animals find a crucial resource, they can survive in changing environments and even thrive.
2019-01-22.snippet: A study showed that when some animals find a crucial resource, they can survive in changing environments and even thrive.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: Look closely up in the trees of a shade-grown cacao plantation in eastern Costa Rica, and you’ll see an array of small furry faces peering back at you. Those are three-toed sloths that make their homes there, clambering ever so slowly into the upper branches to bask in the morning sun. You might also spot them munching on leaves from the guarumo tree, which shades the cacao plants.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Where Sloths Find These Branches, Their Family Trees Expand

2019-01-22.abstract: The designer’s work on “Black Panther” was one of the seven nominations the film received.
2019-01-22.snippet: The designer’s work on “Black Panther” was one of the seven nominations the film received.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: Wakanda forever, indeed. While “Black Panther” joins the small list of films with predominantly black casts to be nominated for best picture, it’s been less forever and more accurately never that an African-American has received a nomination in the production design category. On Tuesday, Hannah Beachler changed history with her nod for the rich African world she helped imagine for “Black Panther.” It’s a highlight in a career already filled with cultural touchstones, including Beyoncé’s “Lemonade” and Barry Jenkins’s “Moonlight.”
2019-01-22.headline_main: Hannah Beachler, the First African-American Oscar Nominee for Production Design, Reacts

2019-01-22.abstract: A British production of “To Kill A Mockingbird” has been canceled after the producer Scott Rudin asserted his stage rights to the book.
2019-01-22.snippet: A British production of “To Kill A Mockingbird” has been canceled after the producer Scott Rudin asserted his stage rights to the book.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: A British touring production of “To Kill a Mockingbird,” which was to start next month, has been canceled after Scott Rudin’s company Atticus — the firm behind the Broadway hit — threatened legal action.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Broadway ‘Mockingbird’ Precludes British ‘Mockingbird’

2019-01-22.abstract: The couple behind the ambitious, perpetually packed restaurant close early to feed a more private audience: their daughters.
2019-01-22.snippet: The couple behind the ambitious, perpetually packed restaurant close early to feed a more private audience: their daughters.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: At Mokonuts, a tiny cafe tucked in a far-flung corner of the 11th arrondissement in Paris, Moko Hirayama bakes her chewy miso-sesame cookies three times a day. She swirls halvah into pecan cake, and mixes rye flour into the buttery crust of her caramel-imbued tarte Tatin. Omar Koreitem, her husband and partner in the restaurant, scents briny cockles with bergamot, slicks mackerel with preserved lemon, and roasts guinea fowl with cabbage and apples.
2019-01-22.headline_main: At Mokonuts in Paris, a Dinner Reservation Is Impossible to Get

2019-01-22.abstract: Middle Eastern near Union Square, mazemen ramen on the Lower East Side and more restaurant news.
2019-01-22.snippet: Middle Eastern near Union Square, mazemen ramen on the Lower East Side and more restaurant news.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: The chef Massimo Sola has been involved in several New York kitchens, including Sola Pasta Bar in SoHo. The latest is in an intimate Italian restaurant owned by Antonio Sinesi and Claudio Della Monica. Mr. Sola and the chef Matteo Limoli are collaborating on the menu, which is more classic than creative. Among the offerings are eggplant parmigiana, fritto misto, linguine with cockles, fettuccine Bolognese, Milanese risotto with osso buco, chicken al mattone and a couple of pizzas, including one topped with black truffles. Il Divo refers to Rudolph Valentino, for whom Mr. Sinesi’s restaurant in Milan is named and who inspired the glamorous décor. (Opens Monday)
2019-01-22.headline_main: Intimate Italian at Il Divo on the Upper East Side

2019-01-22.abstract: Four moderates from the Kansas City metro area have changed parties in the last month, reflecting a national realignment on a key partisan battleground.
2019-01-22.snippet: Four moderates from the Kansas City metro area have changed parties in the last month, reflecting a national realignment on a key partisan battleground.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: LENEXA, Kan. — State Senator Dinah Sykes, a Democrat for three whole weeks, told the retirement home residents that she had felt ignored by Republican leaders. She said that she remained a political moderate. She promised that her views on policy hadn’t changed when she quit the Republican Party, only the letter beside her name.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Kansas Lawmakers Defect to Democrats as G.O.P. Struggles in Suburbs

2019-01-22.abstract: Up for an Academy Award for “Roma,” she says the honor shows “you’re not limited by your race or your class or your ethnicity or your socioeconomic conditions.”
2019-01-22.snippet: Up for an Academy Award for “Roma,” she says the honor shows “you’re not limited by your race or your class or your ethnicity or your socioeconomic conditions.”
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: Yalitza Aparicio had just finished her teaching degree and didn’t yet have a job when the Mexican director Alfonso Cuarón held a casting call in her home of Tlaxiaco, Oaxaca, for the lead role in his semi-autobiographical drama, “Roma.”
2019-01-22.headline_main: Yalitza Aparicio Is the Oscars’ First Indigenous Mexican Actress Nominee

2019-01-22.abstract: Ms. Washington said on “The Tonight Show” on Monday that the Netflix version will “kind of be this movie-play hybrid event.”
2019-01-22.snippet: Ms. Washington said on “The Tonight Show” on Monday that the Netflix version will “kind of be this movie-play hybrid event.”
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: On Monday, Kerry Washington announced on “The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon” that her Broadway play, “American Son,” will be adapted by Netflix. She is set to reprise her role as Kendra, the concerned mother of a son who may be in great danger.
2019-01-22.headline_main: ‘American Son’ Play Starring Kerry Washington Will Be Adapted by Netflix

2019-01-22.abstract: After “Black Panther” earned Marvel Studios its first best-picture nomination, an excited Feige emphasized “the importance of inclusion.”
2019-01-22.snippet: After “Black Panther” earned Marvel Studios its first best-picture nomination, an excited Feige emphasized “the importance of inclusion.”
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: The Oscar nominations are read in Los Angeles at just after 5 in the morning, a time when most late-to-wake Hollywood types would rather be slumbering underneath high-thread-count sheets. Still, the Marvel Studios president Kevin Feige wasn’t about to miss the televised announcement.
2019-01-22.headline_main: The Oscars Didn’t Say Ryan Coogler’s Name, but Marvel’s Kevin Feige Will

2019-01-22.abstract: The new carbon-steel skillet from Made In is ready to tackle almost any stovetop task.
2019-01-22.snippet: The new carbon-steel skillet from Made In is ready to tackle almost any stovetop task.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: Watch a chef deftly toss a portion of potatoes or spaghetti with sauce, and chances are the pan the professional uses is a simple carbon-steel skillet. It’s the workhorse of a restaurant kitchen. Made In, a company that sells cooking utensils directly to consumers, has just introduced such a pan, in an all-purpose 10-inch size. It’s a good conductor (it can be used on an induction cooktop) and has heft; flipping a batch of vegetables takes muscle. The pan also requires seasoning at least once, an all-day process (instructions are included). The company plans to add a 12-inch skillet and a wok to the carbon-steel line.
2019-01-22.headline_main: A Restaurant Workhorse for Your Kitchen

2019-01-22.abstract: Michael Laiskonis, the creative director of the Institute of Culinary Education, is behind Récolte Dessert Bar on the Upper West Side.
2019-01-22.snippet: Michael Laiskonis, the creative director of the Institute of Culinary Education, is behind Récolte Dessert Bar on the Upper West Side.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: Michael Laiskonis, the former executive pastry chef at Le Bernardin, is now the creative director of the Institute of Culinary Education, but he says he missed turning out high-end restaurant-style desserts. So starting Sunday,  he will run an evening dessert bar in an Upper West Side pastry shop, Récolte. It will be open Wednesdays through Sundays, starting at 7 p.m., after the shop closes. Three courses of elegantly fashioned sweets, like a version of s’mores with smoked chocolate, marshmallow and a graham cracker; or a verrine of passion fruit and chocolate in a glass, are $23. There’s also a savory cheese plate. Coffee, tea, chocolate and fruit drinks will be served, but as of now, no alcohol.
2019-01-22.headline_main: After Hours, This Pastry Shop Serves Dessert

2019-01-22.abstract: Let us help you start your day.
2019-01-22.snippet: Let us help you start your day.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: (Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the sign-up.)
2019-01-22.headline_main: Huawei, Naomi Osaka, the Oscars: Your Wednesday Briefing

2019-01-22.abstract: At the Taiwanese teahouse Té Company, the chef Frederico Ribeiro puts his twist on a traditional cake meant to bring good fortune.
2019-01-22.snippet: At the Taiwanese teahouse Té Company, the chef Frederico Ribeiro puts his twist on a traditional cake meant to bring good fortune.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: At the charming West Village teahouse Té Company — which the Portuguese chef Frederico Ribeiro runs with his wife, Elena Liao — you’ll find Taiwanese pineapple linzer cookies. They’re similar to linzer cookies, but they’re Mr. Ribeiro’s take on the Taiwanese pineapple cake that is presented for good luck (originally for engagements and newlyweds, but now, more generally). In the run-up to the Lunar New Year (the Year of the Pig begins on Feb. 5), you may want some cookies on hand for parties or gift-giving. The buttery hazelnut shortbread rounds are dusted with sea salt and enclose pineapple jam seasoned with yuzukosho, made from citrus zest, juice and chiles, to tweak the palate.
2019-01-22.headline_main: A Good Luck Cookie for the Year of the Pig

2019-01-22.abstract: Truth BBQ ships its smoked brisket nationwide from Brenham, Texas. Just add some sides.
2019-01-22.snippet: Truth BBQ ships its smoked brisket nationwide from Brenham, Texas. Just add some sides.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: A mighty slab of smoked brisket can make that Super Bowl gathering an easy success. At his pit joint, Truth BBQ in Brenham, Tex., between Austin and Houston, Leonard Botello IV smokes whole briskets from a nearby ranch for 18 hours. The briskets have been available nationwide, shipped frozen, since late last year. To get the succulent, flavorful meat party-ready, you’ll want to thaw it, then unwrap it, place it in a baking dish, wrap the whole thing, dish and all in foil and slow-roast it. It will serve 8 to 12. Be sure to have plenty of your own sides to serve like coleslaw, baked beans, cornbread, pickles and your favorite barbecue sauce.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Texas Barbecue for Your Super Bowl Party

2019-01-22.abstract: A new leader, Juan Guaidó, is reviving Venezuela’s discredited opposition, seizing on deteriorating conditions and the growing lack of recognition for Mr. Maduro abroad.
2019-01-22.snippet: A new leader, Juan Guaidó, is reviving Venezuela’s discredited opposition, seizing on deteriorating conditions and the growing lack of recognition for Mr. Maduro abroad.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela — A group of soldiers turned against the government and declared allegiance to the opposition. Foreign officials say the government could soon run out of money to meet bare-bones needs. And countries across the region have called the president an illegitimate dictator.
2019-01-22.headline_main: How Juan Guaidó Rose From Being Virtually Unknown to Lead Venezuela’s Opposition

2019-01-22.abstract: Spiked with applejack and gin, this cider cocktail from Union Square Cafe is easy to make at home.
2019-01-22.snippet: Spiked with applejack and gin, this cider cocktail from Union Square Cafe is easy to make at home.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: Union Square Cafe’s spiked market cider has seasonal allure, with a cider base and an attractive fan of apple slices for garnish. They make vats of it in the restaurant and keep it chilled, but the recipe is easy to reproduce at home. To make two drinks: In a jar or pitcher, mix a cup of sweet cider with three ounces of applejack, two of gin, a tablespoon of lemon juice, half a tablespoon of simple syrup (the cafe uses Demerara sugar) and a generous dash of bitters. Chill it for two hours, then pour it into two old-fashioned glasses filled with crushed ice and dust a little nutmeg on top. Poke a display of apple slices into the ice and serve.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Make Union Square Cafe’s Seasonal Cider

2019-01-22.abstract: Best known for the 1960s sitcom “The Mothers-in-Law,” she also had memorable turns in Broadway musicals and rode the nightclub circuit for years.
2019-01-22.snippet: Best known for the 1960s sitcom “The Mothers-in-Law,” she also had memorable turns in Broadway musicals and rode the nightclub circuit for years.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: Kaye Ballard, whose long career as a comedian, actress and nightclub performer included well-regarded runs in “The Golden Apple” and “Carnival!” on Broadway and a classic turn as a television mother-in-law, died on Monday at her home in Rancho Mirage, Calif. She was 93.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Kaye Ballard, Indefatigable Comedian and Actress, Dies at 93

2019-01-22.abstract: Janelle Imports, in Enfield, Conn., sells the traditional stoneware pottery of Boleslawiec, Poland.
2019-01-22.snippet: Janelle Imports, in Enfield, Conn., sells the traditional stoneware pottery of Boleslawiec, Poland.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: For centuries, Boleslawiec in southwestern Poland has been known for its pottery, decorated with traditional folk designs. In 2003, Elle Englander, a native of that city who moved to Suffield, Conn., near Hartford, started importing Boleslawiec pottery to the United States and opened a store selling it in nearby Enfield. Ms. Englander gradually expanded, and now her warehouse store has about 60,000 pieces, many of which are also sold on a website. The stoneware pottery — in bowls, platters, bakeware, teapots and more — is available in scores of patterns at prices starting at $15. The pieces can be used in an oven, microwave, dishwasher and freezer. New shapes and designs are frequently introduced.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Polish Pottery From a Connecticut Source

2019-01-22.abstract: “We stand with you,” Vice President Mike Pence wrote on Twitter a day before planned mass protests.
2019-01-22.snippet: “We stand with you,” Vice President Mike Pence wrote on Twitter a day before planned mass protests.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Vice President Mike Pence on Tuesday declared the United States’ “unwavering support” for planned mass protests in Venezuela against President Nicolás Maduro, the most explicit backing yet by the Trump administration as opposition leaders try to unseat Mr. Maduro.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Pence Tells Venezuelans That U.S. Backs Efforts to Oust Maduro

2019-01-22.snippet: The first vote on whether Britain should leave the European Union created more problems than it solved. A second could do much the same — or even worse.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: LONDON — A second referendum on Britain leaving the European Union is considered likelier than ever.
2019-01-22.headline_main: A Second Brexit Vote Could Worsen the Chaos Created by the First

2019-01-22.abstract: Julia Wolfe’s new oratorio, “Fire in my mouth,” is about the Triangle shirtwaist factory fire. She scoured New York’s garment district for the right sounds.

2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: It wasn’t where you would expect to find the composer Julia Wolfe shopping for musical instruments.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Arming a Chorus of Women With Scissors

2019-01-22.abstract: Yiyun Li began writing her latest novel, “Where Reasons End,” in the months after her teenage son committed suicide in 2017.
2019-01-22.snippet: Yiyun Li began writing her latest novel, “Where Reasons End,” in the months after her teenage son committed suicide in 2017.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: In 2012, the novelist Yiyun Li twice tried to take her own life. She wrote of the experience in “Dear Friend, From My Life I Write to You in Your Life,” a series of enigmatic essays in which she traced her depression and lifelong desire to disappear. “You should be very careful every day for the rest of your life,” she recalled a doctor warning her. “Things could sneak up on you.”
2019-01-22.headline_main: A Mother Loses a Son to Suicide, but Their Dialogue Continues

2019-01-22.abstract: Welcome to another controversy algorithmically designed to tear America apart.
2019-01-22.snippet: Welcome to another controversy algorithmically designed to tear America apart.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: In a short story published last October, “Sort by Controversial,” Scott Alexander imagines a Silicon Valley company that accidentally comes up with an algorithm to generate what it calls a “Scissor.” The scissor is a statement, an idea or a scenario that’s somehow perfectly calibrated to tear people apart — not just by generating disagreement, but by generating total incredulity that somebody could possibly disagree with your interpretation of the controversy, followed by escalating fury and paranoia and polarization, until the debate seems like a completely existential, win-or-perish fight.
2019-01-22.headline_main: The Covington Scissor

2019-01-22.abstract: I hated my uncle abandoning me when I was in prison, but eventually I reclaimed my humanity. Can the rest of Egypt do the same?
2019-01-22.snippet: I hated my uncle abandoning me when I was in prison, but eventually I reclaimed my humanity. Can the rest of Egypt do the same?
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: I always admired my uncle Anas, my mom’s youngest brother and a general in the Egyptian police. He helped shape my sense of justice and discipline. When I was growing up, I had nothing but respect and admiration for him and his work fighting bad guys. Throughout his career — and unlike many of his colleagues — he never believed he was above the law. In a country where corruption is practically a way of life, he refused to wave his badge to get out of paying the train fare or to avoid everyday inconveniences. He genuinely believed that the police were there to maintain order and serve the people.
2019-01-22.headline_main: How a Coup Can Destroy a Family, and How a Family Can Heal

2019-01-22.abstract: A brief statement from the American-led military mission in Afghanistan said the incident was under investigation and provided no further details.
2019-01-22.snippet: A brief statement from the American-led military mission in Afghanistan said the incident was under investigation and provided no further details.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — An American service member was killed by enemy fire in Afghanistan on Tuesday in the second United States combat death there so far this year.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Second American Killed in Afghanistan Since Start of Year

2019-01-22.abstract: He says he and his “Can You Ever Forgive Me?” star, Melissa McCarthy, cried together. “We were just a blub fest. No shame in being a grown man crying.”
2019-01-22.snippet: He says he and his “Can You Ever Forgive Me?” star, Melissa McCarthy, cried together. “We were just a blub fest. No shame in being a grown man crying.”
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: Richard E. Grant was at one of his favorite restaurants in London, having dinner with his daughter, when suddenly both burst into tears. The management rushed over: what was wrong? Nothing. Grant had just been nominated for an Oscar, for his supporting turn as a colorful accomplice in the literary biopic “Can You Ever Forgive Me?” (To celebrate, the staff comped his meal.)
2019-01-22.headline_main: Richard E. Grant Reacts to News of His First Oscar Nomination: With Tears

2019-01-22.abstract: President Jair Bolsonaro set the tone for a Davos gathering with many U.S. and European leaders absent this year, dealing with crises back home.
2019-01-22.snippet: President Jair Bolsonaro set the tone for a Davos gathering with many U.S. and European leaders absent this year, dealing with crises back home.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: DAVOS, Switzerland — President Trump is the biggest no-show at this year’s meeting of the World Economic Forum. But Brazil’s new leader, Jair Bolsonaro, a man whose nickname back home is the “Trump of the Tropics,” stepped in to take up the populist mantle on Tuesday.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Brazil’s Bolsonaro Is the Face of Populism at the Davos Forum

2019-01-22.abstract: Movement Research brings its often private, investigative work into a very public forum: the atrium at the Museum of Modern Art.
2019-01-22.snippet: Movement Research brings its often private, investigative work into a very public forum: the atrium at the Museum of Modern Art.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: How do you move with innate wisdom? That was Michelle Boulé’s question to a group of 30 students in a contemporary dance class last week. They could rest, be in motion or land somewhere in between. The important thing was, as Ms. Boulé put it, “to experience your body as it is now, with no agenda.”
2019-01-22.headline_main: Showing Dance’s Hidden Side at MoMA

2019-01-22.abstract: The concept has been around forever. But suddenly, the term seems to be everywhere.
2019-01-22.snippet: The concept has been around forever. But suddenly, the term seems to be everywhere.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: Welcome to In Her Words, where women rule the headlines. Sign up here to get it delivered to your inbox. Let me know what you think at dearmaya@nytimes.com.
2019-01-22.headline_main: What Is Toxic Masculinity?

2019-01-22.abstract: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.
2019-01-22.snippet: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: I was a single mother working a full-time day job and helping run my roller derby league. I did not trust men, especially in the mostly female space I had co-founded, which was keeping me going after a trying divorce. But Hal was genuine and kind to everyone, and made no demands. He went from fan to volunteer to friend to lover to guy who dropped his entire life to drive me to Missouri to care for my dying mother. I realized I’d be an idiot not to spend the rest of my life with him. — Amy Callner
2019-01-22.headline_main: Tiny Love Stories: ‘I Gout You, Babe’

2019-01-22.abstract: The documentary filmmakers called the Supreme Court justice at home to tell her the news.
2019-01-22.snippet: The documentary filmmakers called the Supreme Court justice at home to tell her the news.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: The star of one of the year’s biggest documentaries is a night owl, not an early riser, and probably had other things on her mind on Tuesday morning than her Oscar chances. So it fell to Betsy West and Julie Cohen, the directors of the documentary “RBG,” to tell Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg that the film was nominated.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Ruth Bader Ginsburg Reacts to Oscar Nomination for ‘RBG’

2019-01-22.abstract: With competing votes planned for Thursday, the Senate will finally move off the sidelines a month into the partial government shutdown.
2019-01-22.snippet: With competing votes planned for Thursday, the Senate will finally move off the sidelines a month into the partial government shutdown.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Senate will hold competing votes on Thursday on President Trump’s proposal to spend $5.7 billion on a border wall and on a Democratic bill that would fund the government through Feb. 8 without a wall. It will be the first time the Senate has stepped off the sidelines to try to end the monthlong government shutdown.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Senate Leaders Plan Competing Bills to End Shutdown

2019-01-22.abstract: Nineteen out of 20 people who have been told they are allergic to penicillin are not truly allergic to the drug.
2019-01-22.snippet: Nineteen out of 20 people who have been told they are allergic to penicillin are not truly allergic to the drug.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: Millions of Americans who believe they are allergic to penicillin are not actually allergic. But they are steered away from using some of the safest, most effective antibiotics, relying instead on substitutes that are often pricier, less effective, and more likely to cause complications such as antibiotic-resistant infections.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Allergic to Penicillin? You May Not Be

2019-01-22.abstract: When the Ukrainian Orthodox Church broke from Russia’s, it dealt a blow to President Vladimir Putin’s efforts to portray his country as one people with a single identity.
2019-01-22.snippet: When the Ukrainian Orthodox Church broke from Russia’s, it dealt a blow to President Vladimir Putin’s efforts to portray his country as one people with a single identity.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: On Jan. 5, some 150,000 people lined up in front of the St. Sophia Cathedral in Ukraine’s capital, Kiev. They came to see a single document called a tomos, issued a few days before by the ecumenical patriarch of Constantinople, Bartholomew. There, on a piece of parchment, written in ornate Greek, English and Ukrainian, were words that the Ukrainian Orthodox Church had dreamed about for centuries: The document made the Ukrainian Church autocephalous, meaning it is now fully independent from Moscow.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Putin’s Dream of Godliness: Holy Russia

2019-01-22.abstract: The Oscar nominations get all the attention, but Tuesday was a busy day for literary honors as well.
2019-01-22.snippet: The Oscar nominations get all the attention, but Tuesday was a busy day for literary honors as well.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: The Oscar nominations get all the attention, but Tuesday was a busy day for literary honors as well. Yale University awarded the $165,000 Bollingen Prize in American Poetry to Charles Bernstein, while the Mystery Writers of America announced their nominees for the annual Edgar Allan Poe Awards and the National Book Critics Circle named the finalists for their prestigious N.B.C.C. Awards.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Bollingen Prize in American Poetry and Nominees for the National Book Critics Circle and Edgar Allan Poe Awards Are Announced

2019-01-22.abstract: With two documentaries bringing new attention to the 2017 music festival disaster, people raised more than $177,000 for a Bahamian restaurant owner who was exploited.
2019-01-22.snippet: With two documentaries bringing new attention to the 2017 music festival disaster, people raised more than $177,000 for a Bahamian restaurant owner who was exploited.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: A Bahamian restaurant owner who lost a fortune as a result of the Fyre Festival debacle has recouped nearly all of her losses after a GoFundMe campaign raised more than $177,000.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Fyre Festival’s Organizers Didn’t Pay a Restaurant Owner, So GoFundMe Donors Stepped In

2019-01-22.abstract: A new breed of products pair high-impact colors with ultra-hydrating formulas, giving lips a much-needed boost this winter.
2019-01-22.snippet: A new breed of products pair high-impact colors with ultra-hydrating formulas, giving lips a much-needed boost this winter.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: If you want your lipstick to last — and really endure for hours — it often means using a matte formula. These products have a dry finish that prevents smudges and wicks away moisture like face powder. But the downside is that many matte lipsticks feel like plaster on your lips and deplete healthy, essential moisture, making them especially unappealing in winter (why increase the risk of chapped lips?). But lately, makeup artists have been embracing matte lipsticks with renewed enthusiasm — no matter the season — thanks in part to a new crop of hybrid formulas.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Matte Lipsticks That Hydrate, and Stay Put, for Hours

2019-01-22.abstract: Just as the United Nations cultural organization reforms, America and Israel quit. That makes no sense.
2019-01-22.snippet: Just as the United Nations cultural organization reforms, America and Israel quit. That makes no sense.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: The United States quit Unesco, the United Nations cultural organization, this month. It did not go quietly. A “cesspool,” Nikki Haley called it. “Unesco is among the most corrupt and politically biased UN agencies,” she tweeted.
2019-01-22.headline_main: The U.S. Should Return to Unesco

2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: On Tuesday, the Supreme Court ruled, 5-4, that the Trump administration could reinstate its policy barring most transgender people from serving in the military while several cases challenging the policy are being decided. The decision was both a devastating blow to me personally, and a disturbing sign of what is to come for transgender people in the United States.

2019-01-22.abstract: As Collins, an unseeded 25-year-old, advanced to the semifinals in Melbourne, a cousin grabbed a flight to Australia while Collins’s parents planned for more late-night viewing in their Florida home.
2019-01-22.snippet: As Collins, an unseeded 25-year-old, advanced to the semifinals in Melbourne, a cousin grabbed a flight to Australia while Collins’s parents planned for more late-night viewing in their Florida home.
2019-01-22.lead_paragraph: MELBOURNE, Australia — Ann Chisholm contemplated traveling from her Minnesota home to watch the main-draw debut of her cousin Danielle Collins at the Australian Open, but it seemed like a flight of fancy. Collins had lost in the first round of the three majors she played last year, and it made little sense for a relative to travel 10,000 miles to see what might be only one match.
2019-01-22.headline_main: Danielle Collins Upends the Australian Open, and Her Family’s Schedule

2019-01-22.abstract: Iran said it had summoned the Swiss ambassador, which acts on behalf of U.S. interests in Tehran, to protest the Jan. 13 arrest of Marzieh Hashemi.
2019-01-22.snippet: Iran said it had summoned the Swiss ambassador, which acts on behalf of U.S. interests in Tehran, to protest the Jan. 13 arrest of Marzieh Hashemi.
